forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 68. West southwest wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog and a slight chance of rain showers between 11pm and 5am, then a chance of rain showers and patchy fog. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 62. West southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon wanes in Downtown San Francisco, a gentle warmth rises, promising a high of 68 degrees amidst partial sunshine. The west-southwest winds carry whispers of the sea, rustling the foliage as they dance around you. However, as evening approaches, a marine layer will weave its way through the city, bringing with it the familiar embrace of patchy fog. The forecast hints at the possibility of light rain showers just after midnight, with clouds gathering like cautious spectators awaiting the performance of nature.

While the day has begun with a hint of vibrancy, the clouds are slowly darkening, urging you to dress in layers—a light sweater will serve you well, ready to fend off the coolness that the night will inevitably usher in. A stroll along the Embarcadero might provide a moment of tranquility, letting the sound of the lapping waves accompany your thoughts. Perhaps plan for a quiet evening indoors, relishing a book or engaging in light conversation over a steaming cup of tea as the gentle fog begins to shroud the skyline, creating an atmosphere best suited for contemplative moments.
